originalText.text: I came across this Fossil watch I had in my storage, it needed battery,, I really wanted this watch working , plus get it extended one bar .. Steve took care of me as soon as I walked in,, He's basically the only one I found ONLINE,,THANKS TO HIM , MY FOSSIL WATCH RETURN FROM THE DEAD...plus it has my Father color Blue,, DALLAS COWBOYS

originalText.text: Most importantly - as of May 11, 2021, this business is definitely open, another review says it closed permanently in March, this is not the case. Steve is operating his normal hours, and continues to do wonderful work! He just rebuilt the heals on a pair of my boots, added a bunch of holes into several of my belts, fixed the zipper on a pair of my jeans, and replaced the motor and battery in my grandmother's very old and very fragile watch. All of the work was perfect and he did it in 24 hours. I wasn't even in a rush, that's just how fast he works. Also, all of this combined was under $60. He's the best and seemingly can do anything. Couldn't recommend more highly.

originalText.text:
This place is a gem! The service is quick,  affordable,  and high quality. For real? Yes! It is also quintessential Harlem, or quintessential old NYC.
Everything happens in this simple little,  friendly, neighborhood,  no-nonsense storefront. Barber shop is in the front half.  And in the back half are shoe repairs,  watch repairs, AND clothing alterations. I love it!
I had shoes re-heeled, re-soled, and polished.  The challenge,  or so I thought,  was one shoe,  a pair I have loved and taken care of for 10 years, where the leather had torn and he fixed it! And not only do all the shoes look good (& the 2 watches work & have nice new bands), the previously broken shoe has weathered several days of wear without  complaining.
And, now, I'm getting the zipper on my down coat replaced-- no more split zipper,  no more "it won't move up or down, I gotta step out of it". I will be warm and comfortable this winter.
I'm very happy this place is in my neighborhood.

originalText.text: It is difficult get a watch repaired in Manhattan without having to take out a mortgage to pay for it. Steve is your man! Don’t let the fact that he’s located in the back of a barbershop in Harlem fool you. Steve is very knowledgeable and is all about customer service. I read many stellar reviews about him and discovered he even refurbishes Rolexes and other high end watches for the larger auction houses in town. I took in 9 watches to have their batteries replaced and for some minor repairs. Steve did a wonderful job at a very reasonable price. And like others have said, he’s a genuinely nice guy.

originalText.text: Great and fast service! I went in and out for 2 watches repair(links removal) and it took less than 10 mns. So happy with Steve's work!
